subject: Re: Test first? or Stub first? (Re: [junit] Re:Re: thoughts on  fail(); in generated tests)
msgSnippet: ... Actually, another point I forgot to mention is that writing the testing code first gets you writing testable code faster. I know that when I m writing unit
messageBody:
On Mon, 20 Jan 2003, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Generally speaking, you don't really know these things until you write
> test code, which is really just sample client code, look at it,
> evaluate it and move on. In general, it is when one sees it "in print"
> than one really looks at it carefully. Writing the test first
> guarantees this, while writing the stub first does not.

Actually, another point I forgot to mention is that writing the testing
code first gets you writing testable code faster. I know that when I'm
writing unit tests for legacy code, I frequently have to change the
design of the code so I can test it more easily.

cjs
